com.birbit.android.jobqueue

Class Params

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.birbit.android.jobqueue.Params

  • public class Params
extends java.lang.Object
    Job builder object to have a more readable design. Methods can be chained to have more readable code.

      • groupBy

        public Params groupBy(java.lang.String groupId)
        Sets the group id. Jobs in the same group are guaranteed to execute sequentially.
        Parameters:
        groupId - which group this job belongs (can be null of course)
        Returns:
        this

      • singleInstanceBy

        public Params singleInstanceBy(java.lang.String singleId)
        Sets the single instance id. If there is another Job with the same single id queued and not yet running, this Job will get Job.onCancel(int, Throwable) called immediately after Job.onAdded() and only the previous Job will run. That is, Job.onRun() will only be called once.

        If no group id was set, one will be set automatically.

        Parameters:
        singleId - which single instance group this job belongs to (can be null of course)
        Returns:
        this

      • persist

        public Params persist()
        Marks the job as persistent. Make sure your job is serializable.
        Returns:
        this

      • clearTags

      • overrideDeadlineToRunInMs

        public Params overrideDeadlineToRunInMs(long deadlineInMs)
        Set a deadline on the job's constraints. After this deadline is reached, the job is run regardless of its constraints.

        Note that even if a job reaches its deadline, JobManager still respects constraints like groupId because when multiple jobs use the same groupId, they usually access shared resources so it is important to respect groupId while running jobs in parallel.

        You can check if a job reached its deadline or not via Job.isDeadlineReached().

        If you call this method, you cannot call overrideDeadlineToCancelInMs(long).

        Parameters:
        deadlineInMs - The deadline in milliseconds for the constraints.
        Returns:
        this
        See Also:
        overrideDeadlineToCancelInMs(long)

      • overrideDeadlineToCancelInMs

        public Params overrideDeadlineToCancelInMs(long deadlineInMs)
        Set a deadline on the job's constraints. After this deadline is reached, the job will be cancelled regardless of its constraints with CancelReason.REACHED_DEADLINE.

        For instance, if you have a job that requires network and if network becomes available at the time deadline is reached, the job will still be cancelled without being run.

        You can check if a job reached its deadline or not via Job.isDeadlineReached().

        Note that even if a job reaches its deadline, JobManager still respects constraints like groupId because when multiple jobs use the same groupId, they usually access shared resources so it is important to respect groupId while running jobs in parallel.

        If you call this method, you cannot call overrideDeadlineToRunInMs(long).

        Parameters:
        deadlineInMs - The deadline in milliseconds for the constraints.
        Returns:
        this
        See Also:
        overrideDeadlineToRunInMs(long)

      • getCancelOnDeadline

        public java.lang.Boolean getCancelOnDeadline()
        Returns what JobManager will do if job reaches its deadline.

        It will be null if Job does not have a deadline.

        Returns:
        null if job does not have a deadline, true if it will be cancelled when it hits the deadline, false if it will be run when it hits the deadline.
